basketball

Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • basketball.Player
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.event.KeyListener, java.util.EventListener

    public class Player
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.awt.event.KeyListener
    The player class designs the movement,controls, and boundaries of both players on the court The class details multiple features of each player on the court including detecting the number of points they score per shot, calculating the miss and make probability depending on the player's distance, creating collisions between players so no player object can go through another, and also setting boundaries of the player. it represents, and how to use it.
    Version:
    May 24, 2019
    Author:
    Lakshay Maharana, Sunhoo Ahn, Shree Phadke, Period: 3, Assignment: Game, Sources: https://www.gamedev.net/forums/topic/348728-java-smooth-keyboard-input/ https://www.gamedev.net/forums/topic/348728-java-smooth-keyboard-input/

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      int number 
      int points 

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Player(int positionX, int positionY, int code)
      Player class constructor which constructs where player is going to be placed and if the player is player1 or player2 on the court.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      int calculatePoints()
      This method determines if the player earns 2 or 3 points based on the region the player is shooting from.
      void check()
      This method looks at the x and y coordinates of the player and then compares them to the x and y coordinates of the boundaries that are set based on the formulas created below and calculated by the program.
      static void collide()
      This method is the helper method which checks if the player is colliding with another player and then resets x and y coordinates to make sure there is a collision between the two players.
      void drawPlayer(java.awt.Graphics g)
      This method draws the player onto the court depending on what the code of the player when initialized.
      int getIsShooting()
      This method returns the number code of the Player who is shooting the ball at that time.
      int getNumber()
      Returns the number code of player (Player 1 or Player 2) in the game, used as a helper method for testing purposes.
      java.awt.Image getPlayerImage()
      This is the getter method for the player's image.
      int getScore()
      This is the getter method for the score of the game.
      static double getShotChance()
      This method is a helper method for the ball class that calculates the probability of the shot going into the hoop based on distance to the hoop and distance and opposing player.
      int getX()
      This is the getter method for the player's x coordinate.
      int getY()
      This is the getter method for the player's y coordinate.
      void go()
      This is the method that adjusts the player's x and y velocities and also continuously checks if the player is in bounds or colliding with another player based on the formula in other helper methods.
      boolean hasBall()
      This method determines if the player possesses the ball or not
      void keyPressed(java.awt.event.KeyEvent e) 
      void keyReleased(java.awt.event.KeyEvent e) 
      void keyTyped(java.awt.event.KeyEvent e)
      Not used.
      void move()
      This is the method which moves the player depending on which boolean is set true for direction and adds or subtracts to the x and y velocity.
      void scoreIncrease()
      This method increases the score of the game if the player makes a shot and calls upon the helper method calculatePoints to calculate if the player gets 2 or 3 points.
      void setHasBall(boolean poss)
      This method sets the boolean hasBall.
      void setIsShooting(int num)
      This method is setter method for the field isShooting and sets which player is shooting the ball.
      void setX(int positionX)
      This is the setter method for the player's x coordinate
      void setY(int positionY)
      This is the setter method for the player's y coordinate
      void shoot()
      This method is a helper method that helps the Ball class determine if the player possesses the ball or not based on the boolean hasBall
      void steal()
      This method calculates if the player on defense is close enough to the player on offensive and then allows for the player on defense to steal the ball with a 20% rate of success.

      • Player

        public Player(int positionX,
              int positionY,
              int code)
        Player class constructor which constructs where player is going to be placed and if the player is player1 or player2 on the court.
        Parameters:
        positionX - the initial x-coordinate of the player
        positionY - the initial y-coordinate of the player
        code - code associated with player which can be 1 or 2

        This method returns the number code of the Player who is shooting the ball at that time.
        Returns:
        The number code corresponding to the player who is shooting the ball

      • hasBall

        public boolean hasBall()
        This method determines if the player possesses the ball or not
        Returns:
        The method returns hasBall, a boolean which is set to true or false depending on if the player has the ball

      • setHasBall

        public void setHasBall(boolean poss)
        This method sets the boolean hasBall.
        Parameters:
        poss - this parameter indicates whether or not the player possesses the ball and sets hasBall accordingly.

      • shoot

        public void shoot()
        This method is a helper method that helps the Ball class determine if the player possesses the ball or not based on the boolean hasBall

      • getShotChance

        public static double getShotChance()
        This method is a helper method for the ball class that calculates the probability of the shot going into the hoop based on distance to the hoop and distance and opposing player.
        Returns:
        the calculated probability of the ball making it into the hoop

      • calculatePoints

        public int calculatePoints()
        This method determines if the player earns 2 or 3 points based on the region the player is shooting from. If the player is behind the 3 point arc, the shot is considered to be a 3 pointer otherwise 2 pointer.
        Returns:

      • keyPressed

        public void keyPressed(java.awt.event.KeyEvent e)
        Specified by:
        keyPressed in interface java.awt.event.KeyListener

      • steal

        public void steal()
        This method calculates if the player on defense is close enough to the player on offensive and then allows for the player on defense to steal the ball with a 20% rate of success.
